column4: qmail: Depends: ucspi-tcp but it is not installable <-- why would this not be installable?
I also see an 'E: broken paackage'
is ucspi-tcp in your repos? Check sudo apt-get update && apt-cache search ucspi
so you don't have the package in your repos. That's the problem. Are you using any unofficial repos?
I'm not that kinda user.. this is stock ubuntu server.. I would expect qmail to install fine
hmm,.. that's weird if it's a stock installation. Have you run partial system updates?
I haven't no, but it is possible one of my admins has.. someone else is actually responsible for this system, but I need to setup qmail :P
how are you trying to install qmail. apt-get install or by a download .deb file?
anyway, it's good practice to run a apt-get update before installing a new package.
qmail is is your repos right? Don't have access to an Ubuntu server to check
qmail is, the other package isnt'
it's not likely that they've included qmail without the deps. :/ Anyway, try sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install qmail
that was for you.. sorry ganadist
